instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short On Adapter Sense
threads.message: I have a board that runs fine on battery, however I get no green light on the charger. All the power rails are there and even adapter sense but only at <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>. There is most likely an internal short on Adapter Sense as there is no continuity from pin 5 of <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> to pin 5 of the DC In connector. Pin 5 of the DC In connector is shorted to ground along with what I assume is the associated test point nearby. Adapter sense is not shorted by <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> however. Is there an arts and crafty way to save this board?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short On Adapter Sense
threads.message:
Your magsafe should be (more or less) similar...
Check for shorted caps on sense line.
You also have an open serie resistor (like Rp).

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short On Adapter Sense
threads.message: Just isolate pin 5 of the DC connector and run a wire to <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short On Adapter Sense
threads.message: Thanks Duke I did that covered it with some kapton tape to look official and it is working nicely!
